intro: Medinilla malindangensis, commonly known as the Malindang Medinilla, is a rare and endemic species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Myristicaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, with glossy, dark green leaves. Its flowers, which are usually pink or white, are highly ornamental and attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
